@before

Use @before decorator to execute function before page rendering. It is used to add variables to the page context.

Usage

@before(*sources: str)
def function(item: SiteItem):
    return dict

Decorator arguments

  • *sources – items are match by sources, file matching supported.

Function arguments

  • item – SiteItem object (argument is optional).

Function returns

Dict which updates items metadata.

Example

from stado import run, before

@before('index.html')
def add_title():
    return {'title': 'Hello'}

run()

*File index.html:

{{ title }}

Rendered file output/index.html:

Hello

Details

@before decorator can take any number of paths and also supports file matching.

@before('index.html', '*.html')
def add_title():
    return {'title': 'Hello'}

@before decorator can pass a page object to a function using function first argument.

@before('index.html')
def add_title(page):
    page['title'] = page.source
